intro: Callicarpa kinabaluensis var. endertii, commonly known as the Bornean beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant native to the montane forests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking, violet-purple berries that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth, glossy surface. The flowers are small, white, and clustered in umbels, often appearing before the berries mature.
